questions.question: How often do you update your devices
questions.explanation: Regular software updates help patch security vulnerabilities that hackers could exploit. Set up automatic updates if possible

questions.question: Is it safe to re-use old passwords
questions.explanation: (2FA) is an identity and access management security method that requires two forms of identification to access resources and data

questions.question: Do you inform your team on how to stay safe online
questions.explanation: Provide cybersecurity training to your employees, covering topics like phishing awareness and safe internet browsing habits

questions.question: Is it smart to click on unknown links
questions.explanation: Clicking on an unknown link can set off a malware download that contains malicious files capable of harvesting information stored on your device

questions.question: Does using encryption help you stay safe from hackers
questions.explanation: Use encryption for sensitive data, both in transit (e.g., using HTTPS) and at rest (e.g., encrypting files or databases)

questions.question: Do you have a plan for when  your data is compromised
questions.explanation: Create a comprehensive disaster recovery plan outlining steps to take in case of a cyber incident, including data backup and restoration procedures

What does 2FA stand for

questions.question: Why should you use 2FA

button.text: To make it more difficult to login
To make it more difficult for hackers to gain access to your account

questions.explanation: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) (like 2FA) whenever possible to add an extra layer of security beyond just a password

questions.question: You find an USB on the street, should you stick it in your pc
questions.explanation: Someone could have put a virus on the USB, sticking it in your PC for even 1 second is enough to compromise your device
